person.content:
Please identify the "Person" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Person". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: Witnesses said they had been seized by troops loyal to President Ange-Felix Patasse at dawn on Thursday when they clashed with soldiers staging a mutiny since November 16 .

Let's think step by step.

| Person |
| --- |
| Witnesses |
| President Ange-Felix Patasse |

Explanation:

1. Witnesses: This is a plural form of person and refers to individuals who have seen or experienced something.
2. President Ange-Felix Patasse: This is a specific person, the president of the Central African Republic at the time of the event described in the paragraph.

2. President Ange-Felix Patasse: This is a specific person, the president of the Central African Republic at the time of the event described in the paragraph.

organization.content:
Please identify the "Organization" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Organization". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: Witnesses said they had been seized by troops loyal to President Ange-Felix Patasse at dawn on Thursday when they clashed with soldiers staging a mutiny since November 16 .

Let's think step by step.

| Organization |
| --- |
| troops loyal to President Ange-Felix Patasse |
| soldiers staging a mutiny |

In the given paragraph, there are two "Organization" entities:

1. troops loyal to President Ange-Felix Patasse: This refers to a group of soldiers or military personnel who are loyal to the president of a country, Ange-Felix Patasse.
2. soldiers staging a mutiny: This refers to a group of soldiers who are rebelling against the authority, in this case, the government led by President Ange-Felix Patasse. The mutiny had started on November 16.

2. soldiers staging a mutiny: This refers to a group of soldiers who are rebelling against the authority, in this case, the government led by President Ange-Felix Patasse. The mutiny had started on November 16.
